name: Mohamed Fat-hy
title: Software Engineer
subtitle: Polyglot Developer • Flutter & Cross-Stack Engineer
summary: Software Engineer with over 5 years of experience building scalable, high-performance applications. I am a versatile, multi-stack developer with a strong foundation in Flutter, now delivering robust backend solutions using Spring Boot, .NET, and JavaScript (Cloud Functions). I focus on technical adaptability, Clean Architecture, and AI-integrated systems. Open to relocation.
about: I started my professional journey in Civil Engineering, which built my foundation in analytical thinking and rapid problem-solving.
Transitioning into software engineering taught me to be a 'polyglot' developer—focusing on architectural patterns that apply across any language or framework.
I have 5+ years of experience delivering production apps used across multiple countries, specializing in bridging the gap between mobile frontends and complex backends.
I thrive on technical variety: I architect mobile apps in Flutter, build enterprise backends in Spring Boot, and deploy serverless logic using JS Cloud Functions and Cloud Run.
On the backend, I leverage Spring Boot for robust service layers, .NET for modern web APIs, and JavaScript for agile cloud-native deployments.
I am currently focused on Generative AI integration, using Spring AI to build intelligent, data-driven features directly into the product core.
I have served as a Tech Lead, managing feature delivery and cross-team communication between mobile, backend, and design teams.
I use AI tools extensively to accelerate the engineering lifecycle—from research and prototyping to debugging and architectural design.
I am highly adaptable, an ownership-driven teammate, and open to relocation for the right opportunity.
